meanings.definition: Added or connected in a subordinate or auxiliary capacity.
meanings.sent1: The adjunctive information helped clarify the main idea.
meanings.sent2: She used adjunctive materials to enhance her presentation.
meanings.sent3: The adjunctive decorations made the room look more festive.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like an adjunctive ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The adjunctive colors in the painting brought it to life.

meanings.definition: A thing added to something else as a supplementary rather than an essential part.
meanings.sent1: The textbook came with an adjunctive CD for extra practice.
meanings.sent2: The new software update included several adjunctive features.
meanings.sent3: The little toy car was an adjunctive gift with the purchase.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was an adjunctive melody to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The icing on the cake was the perfect adjunctive touch to the dessert.
